description: The SNMP trap that is generated by a unit when it detect a power lost.
It's the equivalent of the 802.3ah dying gasp.

event.Summary: $v1 unit $v5 has lost power. Serial Number: $v4

objects.test: $SNMPTRAPCMD ACD-DESC-MIB::acdPowerLost ACD-DESC-MIB::acdDescCommercialName s EXAMPLE ACD-DESC-MIB::acdDescMacBaseAddr s EXAMPLE ACD-DESC-MIB::acdDescIdentifier s EXAMPLE ACD-DESC-MIB::acdDescSerialNumber s EXAMPLE SNMPv2-MIB::sysName s EXAMPLE

description: This string is to describe the type of device.
variables.name: ACD-DESC-MIB::acdDescCommercialName

description: This is the Base of the EtherNID MAC addresses.
variables.name: ACD-DESC-MIB::acdDescMacBaseAddr

description: Identifies the EtherNID on your network.
variables.name: ACD-DESC-MIB::acdDescIdentifier

description: An administratively-assigned name for this managed
node. By convention, this is the node's fully-qualified
domain name. If the name is unknown, the value is
variables.name: SNMPv2-MIB::sysName
